trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app with Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app with Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure App Service to send push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure App Service to send push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the [Xamarin.Forms quickstart tutorial](app-service-mobile-xamarin-forms-get-started.md), which you must complete first.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the [Xamarin.Forms quickstart tutorial](app-service-mobile-xamarin-forms-get-started.md), which you must complete first.

trans-unit.source: You will add push notifications support for each project that your want to support in the the Xamarin.Forms quick start project.
trans-unit.target: You will add push notifications support for each project that your want to support in the the Xamarin.Forms quick start project.

trans-unit.source: Every time a record is inserted, a push notification will be sent.
trans-unit.target: Every time a record is inserted, a push notification will be sent.

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).

trans-unit.source: The [iOS simulator does not support push notifications](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/iOS_Simulator_Guide/TestingontheiOSSimulator.html), so you must use a physical iOS device.
trans-unit.target: The [iOS simulator does not support push notifications](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/iOS_Simulator_Guide/TestingontheiOSSimulator.html), so you must use a physical iOS device.

trans-unit.source: You'll also need to sign up for an [Apple Developer Program membership](https://developer.apple.com/programs/ios/).
trans-unit.target: You'll also need to sign up for an [Apple Developer Program membership](https://developer.apple.com/programs/ios/).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account yet, sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile apps.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account yet, sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile apps.

trans-unit.source: You can keep using them even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: You can keep using them even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: A Mac with [Xamarin Studio] and [Xcode] v4.4 or later installed it.
trans-unit.target: A Mac with [Xamarin Studio] and [Xcode] v4.4 or later installed it.

trans-unit.source: You can run the Xamarin.Forms app using Visual Studio on a Windows computer if you want, but it's a bit more complicated because you have to connect to a networked Mac running the Xamarin.iOS Build Host.
trans-unit.target: You can run the Xamarin.Forms app using Visual Studio on a Windows computer if you want, but it's a bit more complicated because you have to connect to a networked Mac running the Xamarin.iOS Build Host.

trans-unit.source: If you're interested in doing that, see [Installing Xamarin.iOS on Windows].
trans-unit.target: If you're interested in doing that, see [Installing Xamarin.iOS on Windows].

trans-unit.source: A physical iOS device.
trans-unit.target: A physical iOS device.

trans-unit.source: Push notifications are not supported by the iOS simulator.
trans-unit.target: Push notifications are not supported by the iOS simulator.

trans-unit.source: Complete the [Xamarin.Forms quickstart tutorial](app-service-mobile-xamarin-forms-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Complete the [Xamarin.Forms quickstart tutorial](app-service-mobile-xamarin-forms-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a Notification Hub for your Mobile App
trans-unit.target: Create a Notification Hub for your Mobile App

trans-unit.source: To configure your app to send notifications, create a new notification hub and configure it for the platform notification services that you will use.
trans-unit.target: To configure your app to send notifications, create a new notification hub and configure it for the platform notification services that you will use.

trans-unit.source: These steps walk you through creating a new notification hub.
trans-unit.target: These steps walk you through creating a new notification hub.

trans-unit.source: If you already have one created, you can just select it.
trans-unit.target: If you already have one created, you can just select it.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse** > **Mobile Apps** > your backend > **Settings** > **Mobile** > **Push** > **Notification Hub** > **+ Notification Hub**, and provide a name and namespace for a new notification hub, and then click the **OK** button.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse** > **Mobile Apps** > your backend > **Settings** > **Mobile** > **Push** > **Notification Hub** > **+ Notification Hub**, and provide a name and namespace for a new notification hub, and then click the **OK** button.

trans-unit.source: In the Create Notification Hub blade, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the Create Notification Hub blade, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Update the server project to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the server project to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Deploy the updated server project to Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy the updated server project to Azure

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Configure and run the Android project
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Configure and run the Android project

trans-unit.source: This section is for running the Xamarin droid project for Android.
trans-unit.target: This section is for running the Xamarin droid project for Android.

trans-unit.source: You can skip this section if you are not working with Android devices.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this section if you are not working with Android devices.

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging (GCM)
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging (GCM)

trans-unit.source: Configure the notification hub for GCM
trans-unit.target: Configure the notification hub for GCM

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse** > **Mobile Apps** > your Mobile App > **Settings** > **Push** > **Google (GCM)**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse** > **Mobile Apps** > your Mobile App > **Settings** > **Push** > **Google (GCM)**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the server api key you created earlier and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the server api key you created earlier and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Your service is now configured to work with push notifications for Android.
trans-unit.target: Your service is now configured to work with push notifications for Android.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to the droid project
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to the droid project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Components folder, click Get More Components..., search for the **Google Cloud Messaging Client** component and add it to the project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Components folder, click Get More Components..., search for the **Google Cloud Messaging Client** component and add it to the project.

trans-unit.source: This component helps simplify working with push notifications with a Xamarrin Android project.
trans-unit.target: This component helps simplify working with push notifications with a Xamarrin Android project.

trans-unit.source: Open the MainActivity.cs project file and add the following using statement at the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: Open the MainActivity.cs project file and add the following using statement at the top of the file:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the `OnCreate` method after the call to `LoadApplication`.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the `OnCreate` method after the call to `LoadApplication`.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code for the `CreateAndShowDialog` helper method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code for the `CreateAndShowDialog` helper method.

trans-unit.source: In the `MainActivity` class, add the following code to expose the current `MainActivity` so we can execute some UI on the main UI thread:
trans-unit.target: In the `MainActivity` class, add the following code to expose the current `MainActivity` so we can execute some UI on the main UI thread:

trans-unit.source: Initialize the `instance`, variable at the beginning of the `MainActivity.OnCreate` method.
trans-unit.target: Initialize the `instance`, variable at the beginning of the `MainActivity.OnCreate` method.

trans-unit.source: Add a new class file to the **Droid** project.
trans-unit.target: Add a new class file to the **Droid** project.

trans-unit.source: Name the new class file **GcmService**.
trans-unit.target: Name the new class file **GcmService**.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the following `using` statements are included at the top of the file.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the following `using` statements are included at the top of the file.

trans-unit.source: Add the following permission requests at the top of the file, after the `using` statments and before the `namespace` declaration.
trans-unit.target: Add the following permission requests at the top of the file, after the `using` statments and before the `namespace` declaration.

trans-unit.source: Add the following class definition to the namespace.
trans-unit.target: Add the following class definition to the namespace.

trans-unit.source: Replace **<PROJECT_NUMBER>** with your project number you noted earlier.
trans-unit.target: Replace **<PROJECT_NUMBER>** with your project number you noted earlier.

trans-unit.source: Update your `GcmService` class to use the new broadcast receiver.
trans-unit.target: Update your `GcmService` class to use the new broadcast receiver.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the GcmService class that overrides the OnRegistered event handler and implements a `Register` method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the GcmService class that overrides the OnRegistered event handler and implements a `Register` method.

trans-unit.source: This code will register a template body to receive template notifications using the `messageParam` parameter.
trans-unit.target: This code will register a template body to receive template notifications using the `messageParam` parameter.

trans-unit.source: Template notifications allow you to send notifications cross platform.
trans-unit.target: Template notifications allow you to send notifications cross platform.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, [Templates](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn530748.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information see, [Templates](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn530748.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You must implement `OnMessage` to handle an incoming push notification.
trans-unit.target: You must implement `OnMessage` to handle an incoming push notification.

trans-unit.source: In this code we will handle the notification and send it to the notification manager.
trans-unit.target: In this code we will handle the notification and send it to the notification manager.

trans-unit.source: You must also implement `OnUnRegistered` and `OnError` handlers for the receiver.
trans-unit.target: You must also implement `OnUnRegistered` and `OnError` handlers for the receiver.

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your Android app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your Android app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, right click the **droid** project and click **Set as startup project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, right click the **droid** project and click **Set as startup project**.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click **OK** to accept push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click **OK** to accept push notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.

trans-unit.source: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.
trans-unit.target: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type a task, and then click the plus (**+**) icon.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type a task, and then click the plus (**+**) icon.

trans-unit.source: Verify that a notification is received, then click **OK** to dismiss the notification.
trans-unit.target: Verify that a notification is received, then click **OK** to dismiss the notification.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Configure and run the iOS project
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Configure and run the iOS project

trans-unit.source: This section is for running the Xamarin iOS project for iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: This section is for running the Xamarin iOS project for iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: You can skip this section if you are not working with iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this section if you are not working with iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Configure the notification hub for APNS
trans-unit.target: Configure the notification hub for APNS

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse** > **Mobile Apps** > your Mobile App > **Settings** > **Push** > **Apple (APNS)** > **Upload Certificate**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse** > **Mobile Apps** > your Mobile App > **Settings** > **Push** > **Apple (APNS)** > **Upload Certificate**.

trans-unit.source: Upload the .p12 push certificate file you exported earlier.
trans-unit.target: Upload the .p12 push certificate file you exported earlier.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to select **Sandbox** if you created a development push certificate for development and testing.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to select **Sandbox** if you created a development push certificate for development and testing.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, choose **Production**.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, choose **Production**.

trans-unit.source: Your service is now configured to work with push notifications for iOS.
trans-unit.target: Your service is now configured to work with push notifications for iOS.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your iOS app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your iOS app

trans-unit.source: Add the following `using` statement to the top of the **AppDelegate.cs** file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following `using` statement to the top of the **AppDelegate.cs** file.

trans-unit.source: In the iOS project, open AppDelegate.cs and update`FinishedLaunching` to support remote notifications as follows.
trans-unit.target: In the iOS project, open AppDelegate.cs and update`FinishedLaunching` to support remote notifications as follows.

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.cs, also add an override for the **RegisteredForRemoteNotifications** event to register for notifications:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.cs, also add an override for the **RegisteredForRemoteNotifications** event to register for notifications:

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.cs also add an override for the **DidReceivedRemoteNotification** event to handle incoming notifications while the app is running:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.cs also add an override for the **DidReceivedRemoteNotification** event to handle incoming notifications while the app is running:

trans-unit.source: Your app is now updated to support push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now updated to support push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your iOS app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your iOS app

trans-unit.source: Right click the iOS project, and click **Set as StartPp Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right click the iOS project, and click **Set as StartPp Project**.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button or **F5** in Visual Studio to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click **OK** to accept push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button or **F5** in Visual Studio to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click **OK** to accept push notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.

trans-unit.source: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.
trans-unit.target: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type a task, and then click the plus (**+**) icon.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type a task, and then click the plus (**+**) icon.

trans-unit.source: Verify that a notification is received, then click **OK** to dismiss the notification.
trans-unit.target: Verify that a notification is received, then click **OK** to dismiss the notification.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Configure and run the Windows project
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Configure and run the Windows project

trans-unit.source: This section is for running the Xamarin WinApp project for Windows devices.
trans-unit.target: This section is for running the Xamarin WinApp project for Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: You can skip this section if you are not working with Windows devices.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this section if you are not working with Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: Register your Windows app for push notifications with WNS
trans-unit.target: Register your Windows app for push notifications with WNS

trans-unit.source: Configure the notification hub for WNS
trans-unit.target: Configure the notification hub for WNS

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Windows app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open **App.xaml.cs** in the **WinApp** project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open **App.xaml.cs** in the **WinApp** project.

trans-unit.source: Add the following `using` statements.
trans-unit.target: Add the following `using` statements.

trans-unit.source: In App.xaml.cs add the following `InitNotificationsAsync` method.
trans-unit.target: In App.xaml.cs add the following `InitNotificationsAsync` method.

trans-unit.source: This method gets the push notification channel and registers a template to receive template notifications from notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This method gets the push notification channel and registers a template to receive template notifications from notification hub.

trans-unit.source: A template notification that supports `messageParam` will be delivered to this client.
trans-unit.target: A template notification that supports `messageParam` will be delivered to this client.

trans-unit.source: In App.xaml.cs update the `OnLaunched` event handler with the `async` attribute and call `InitNotificationsAsync`
trans-unit.target: In App.xaml.cs update the `OnLaunched` event handler with the `async` attribute and call `InitNotificationsAsync`

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer for Visual Studio, open the **Package.appxmanifest** file and set **Toast Capable** to **Yes** under **Notifications**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer for Visual Studio, open the **Package.appxmanifest** file and set **Toast Capable** to **Yes** under **Notifications**.

trans-unit.source: Build the app and verify you have no errors.
trans-unit.target: Build the app and verify you have no errors.

trans-unit.source: You client app should now register for the template notifications from the Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: You client app should now register for the template notifications from the Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your Windows app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right click the **WinApp** project and click **Set as startup project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right click the **WinApp** project and click **Set as startup project**.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click **OK** to accept push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click **OK** to accept push notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.

trans-unit.source: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.
trans-unit.target: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type a task, and then click the plus (**+**) icon.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type a task, and then click the plus (**+**) icon.

trans-unit.source: Verify that a notification is received, then click **OK** to dismiss the notification.
trans-unit.target: Verify that a notification is received, then click **OK** to dismiss the notification.
